headline: Veronica's Hot Spinach, Artichoke and Chile Dip
description: Green chiles and jalapeno peppers spice up this spin on the classic party dip.

video.description: If you’re a fan of spinach and artichoke, then this dip is for you!
video.name: Veronica's Hot Spinach, Artichoke and Chile Dip

name: Veronica's Hot Spinach, Artichoke and Chile Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (4.5 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained
1 (12 ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
0.25 cup canned chopped jalapeno peppers, drained
1 (10 ounce) box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix together the cream cheese and mayonnaise in a bowl until smooth. Stir in the green chiles, Parmesan cheese, artichokes, peppers, and spinach. Spoon the mixture into a baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until slightly browned, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This was delicious! I doubled the spinach and skipped the hatch chiles because I did not have them.
i've been making this for holidays and potlucks for years now and it is always a HUGE hit! i usually make double and keep one at home for us. this will always be one of my go-tos!

2021: Made for Ladies Night Xmas party. Followed others suggestions of 1/4 C Mayo + 1/4 C Sour Cream, as well as 1/2 C Parmesan + Mozarella. Fit perfectly in my small 1.5 Qt. crock pot. Cooked 2 hrs at Low. A VERY yummy flavor.
Wholly Guacamole this is good. Use fresh jalapeno and double artichoke. Squeeze out water from spinach and artichoke. Pulse in food processor a few times. Add little sour cream.
Excellent Dip! Made it for Christmas Holidays and it didn’t disappoint. I added Jalapeño peppers for a spicy kick.
Oh my gosh! I made it exactly as the recipe calls for and this stuff is the bomb! I served it with On the Border corn chips. It made a whole pie plate full too!
This dip is amazing. I will definately make it again.
mmmmmmm

Halved the recipe to serve 5. Stuck to the recipe pretty closely except that I added 2 cloves of garlic as someone in the comments suggested and topped with additional Parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, smoked paprika and cayenne. Definitely recommend serving with tortilla chips instead of bread because the crunchy contrast makes the dip extra tasty.

We have made this several times, always a hit. Sometimes we add more green chilis or jalapeños but it is just a preference how much “kick” you want it to have, we always get rave reviews when we make it and I have given the recipe out to several people after taking it to gatherings.
I used fresh jalapeno's, along with some red chili flakes. I also used a little sour cream. It was pretty yummy!
Made exactly as written. Very good. Might like it with a little sour cream next time.
I didn't have mayo so I swapped it for sour cream. Everyone loved it!
Didn’t add spinach, or green chil, tasted great

I hate to review this considering the changes I made, but the basic dish is excellent. Sometimes, depending on the crowd and/or simply what you have on hand, recipes don't always get followed to the letter...so here goes....

I made this for my daughter who at 43 years old still hasn't managed to get over her childhood hate of spinach! That said, I left it out, but doubled the artichokes instead, using bottoms rather than hearts as this is what was in the cupboard. And not being a fan of mayonnaise, I substituted the same amount of sour cream as a replacement. 

The dip was a huge hit at her party and was gobbled up fast! For "crackers," I thinly sliced a fresh baguette, brushed each piece with olive oil, and baked for about 10 minutes. YUM!
This is a constant request for gatherings with neighbors and friends.
No changes made. Too much cream cheese. Next time I'll use one block
Perfect amount of spice! I threw it all in a crockpot and it turned out great. Definitely a keeper.
Very good Really rich
I have made this many, many times. I sup chopped green chilis for the jalapeno (for guests) and add garlic. This stuff is addictive and always the first app to go.

What A Hit!!! This dish was the biggest winner and first to go at our potluck. Everyone kept going back for more!
I added some crushed red chili pepper to add additional dimension. Also, I added an extra 15min of bake time to create a crunchier top.
I used only jalapeños in this and everyone loved it. It is good at room temperature too. I took it to a pot luck party and not a single drop was left.
I made the recipe as it was written. I wouldn’t change a thing. It was fantastic!

I wasn't sure which Chili peppers to use, so I just deleted the Chili peppers, but used the green chili's. People told me it was the best spinach artichoke dip they had ever had. Otherwise, exactly as written.
This was the best dip EVER! Loved it!

Everyone loved it. I didn't change any aspect of the recipe. The only change I would consider for the next go around would be to add sour cream to thin it down just a little bit. It was a definite crowd pleaser though for all who ate it-a definite make again.
Very tasty, everyone loved the flavors.
I made this for Christmas Eve dinner at my daughters house and it was amazing. Lick the bowl clean delicious! ...and not greasy at all like many other recipes I have tried.
Favorite dip so far. It has a little zing which makes it that more yummy. I also added a can of water chestnuts for some crunch.
This recipe was great! I took it to a Christmas party and I got so many compliments on it. They were also asking me for the recipe. I didn't add the jalepeno peppers, and I added 2 cloves of garlic.

I made this and it was delish but I did make changes. 
Instead of Jarred artichokes, I used 2 cans artichokes, drained, rinsed and chopped
Added 2 or 3 cloves garlic, pressed
Added 5 ounces or so pepper jack cheese, shredded
Added 2 fresh jalapenas, seeded and chopped.
Everyone loved it!
so good perfect amount of jalapino
I roasted one heaping tablespoon of chopped garlic in olive oil and added it to the ingredients. It was delicious.
A delicious turn on an old favorite. Def a keeper.
Not good. I’m not sure why everyone is raving. Not creamy enough in comparison to all the add ins. Followed directions exactly.
Made this for an office potluck - used neufchatel cheese and canola mayonnaise. It's gotten rave reviews and makes enough for a crowd! I will definitely make it again!

I keep making for parties and have to go home, dig out the recipe and share it with other guests. 

It is always a hit!
I made it exactly as the directions say and it turned out perfect! My husband and I like spice in our food so this was a very nice variation of a yummy appetizer.
Delicious. Added some garlic powder and used marinated artichokes and a fresh jalapeño.
Love this. I bring this to potlucks and my little crockpot is wiped clean. I don't like mayo so just add more sour cream. This is the best Spin dip there is!

Got many rave reviews over this recipe - For my notes for next time as I cannot find a place to add notes once you save the recipe - I used 1/2 mayo and 1/2 cream cheese - I used jalapeno sweet and hot peppers and diced them up in a manual food chopper vs the chiles - I also added garlic powder and onion flakes.. I made half what the recipe called for and it was perfect for a party of six. I did, however, use 3/4 of the 8 oz box of spinach - My guests told me the dip was restaurant quality. Next time I think I will try adding fresh crab meat.

This is literally my go-to appy recipe for guests or for bringing to a pot luck etc. I do not even think twice about it. Only problem is, my friends and family have requested the recipe and now we have to double check with eachother that we don't make it twice!!

Excellent recipe - it had great flavor. I halved the recipe since there were only 2 of us, and chose not to add jalapenos, but did use the green chiles. I thought the addition of the green chiles really gave it great flavor. I live in New Mexico, so I had Hatch green chiles I got freshly roasted, then froze, during chile harvest season in August.

Everything about this recipe is right... the cream cheese, the mayo, and especially - the jalapeños. I like to serve this dip on sliced sour dough baguette. It’s a family fav, and an over-eaters delight! I don’t know who you are Veronica, but “thank you, girl”... you’re my kinda chick ;)

This recipe + modifications from other reviews + modifications for what I had in my kitchen resulted in: 2 packs of cream cheese, 3 packs of frozen spinach, 2 drained jars of artichoke hearts, a little salt and fresh pepper, 3 fresh jalapenos - seeded and soaked in water to reduce the heat, 3 cloves of garlic, and Greek yogurt instead of mayo, 1 5oz tub of parmesan cheese, and about 3 oz of feta cheese. I'm making some bread in the bread maker to go with it!
Super tasty!

pretty good, but there is way too much spinach in this recipe, so it turned out hard and dry. theres not enough creaminess and too much spinach. I will use this recipe again but with half the amount of spinach.
Great football day dip -- it was gone shortly after I took it out of the oven. Delicious!
awesome
Yummy!
A great dip, will definitely make it again.

I'm not much of a cook and this made me look really good. I added a couple of tablespoons of lemon juice and subbed 1 can of Rotel for the peppers. I mixed it all in a bowl and let it sit for a couple of hours in the frig. Baked it in a crockery pan for an hour at 350. Very easy.
Love this recipe! My family and I agree, very tasty! The only tweak we make is less mayo, only like a few tablespoons, and use sour cream in its place.
This is our favorite recipe! We make it any time we have to bring an appetizer and everyone always loves it as well.
Perfect when made recipe as written!
Made as directed. It was good, but bland. The only real flavor was the heat from all the peppers. I was hoping for something more restaurant-style and this, while OK, was not it.
I made this exactly by the recipe instructions and it was fabulous! Everyone at our gathering loved it and asked for the recipe. Thanks so much for sharing!
This was a very good spinach and artichoke dip. This is going into my recipe box as my new "go to" recipe for spin/art dip! Thanks for sharing this recipe!
We thought this was the best artichoke/spinach dip we've ever had!

Wow. This is really great. I don't like to use frozen spinach so I wilted my own. I chopped 2 pounds of baby spinach and wilted in 1 tablespoon of olive oil with a pinch of salt. Then drain in a colander while I prepared everything else. I substituted 1/2 of the mayo for sour cream. also added a tablespoon or so of chopped garlic. Once I had it in the baking dish, I sprinkled the top with parmesan so that it would get a nice brown crust. Served with French bread slices that I toasted with oil.

I've made this a few times for various occasions and every time it's a hit. The recipe is forgiving so don't worry about exact amounts - you can adapt based on how spicy you like it. People constantly ask me for the recipe. Definitely a favourite!

Served hot at church coffee hour with "scoops" multigrain Toastida chips. A smash hit. Everyone came back for more.
Great dish. I used 2 Tbsp instead of 4 Tbsp of jalapeno just because of the mixed ages in the group. 
 
So easy, so delicious, so flavorful. Classic!!! Thank you.
I only had 4 oz. of cream cheese and Kraft grated parm cheese and it still turned out very well. I've been asked to bring it to Christmas as an appetizer.
Made this pretty much per instructions. Added a touch of garlic and had to cook it for 45 in and electric oven. Rave reviews and a great recipe to experiment with and add to.
Such a big hit!! Totally recommend it. Easiest recipient I have ever made. Will make again. Thank you!
Delicious! A Thanksgiving appetizer staple for us!
Great recipe. I have made this many times.
The only change I made was to add garlic and use twice the green chilies instead of jalapeños because hubs hates jalapeños. Great recipe!

I get requests for this dip to bring to parties constantly. I add extra jalapeños because I prefer more heat, but this dip is amazing as is! Thank you for sharing! I also add imitation crab meat on occasion and sprinkle mozzarella cheese on the top the last 5-8 minutes of baking.
Love it. I left out the spinach, added 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, and sprinkled smoked paprika on top before baking. Used both the green chilis and jalapenos.
Ive made this over and over again. One of the few recipes my family begs for. Made no changes, it is perfect the way it is.
I would make this again it was pretty good.

I made this tonight for my brother in laws 50th birthday party. It was a crowd pleaser! The only things I changed was halving the amount of mayonnaise and substituting it with sour cream. I also added 1 additional (6.5 oz) jar of artichokes per my preference. I forgot to take my cream cheese out to soften so I put it in the microwave for about 30 seconds and then added the mayo and sour cream, folding it over until it was smooth. Hands down the best Spinach Artichoke dip I have ever tasted, and I am quite the connoisseur of this dip. I also put this in a slow cooker on high for 1 hour and then turned it down low for another 2 before the party. I will definitely be making this again.
Made it without the peppers, but added minced garlic and also bacon. Huge hit!

Turned out great!!! I added a few dashes of hot sauce, pepper, and garlic salt to give it more flavor... Added freshly shredded pepper jack cheese to melt on top... Next time I might use hot chiles and hot jalapeños to zest it up!
We doubled the amount of jalapenos.
Awesome, puts any dip you get from a restaurant to shame.

This was amazing! I did as other reviewers 1/3 c mayo 1/3 c sour cream. Could have used a bit more spinach but overall delicious. Has so much more flavor than traditional spinach dip. I did not think this was spicy-it's good for the masses. I would add more jalapeños next time because I like things spicy. This will be my go to spinach dip!

This dip is ALWAYS requested every year for Christmas and it doesn't last long. I've made this dip more times than I can remember and I've always gotten rave reviews. This is one recipe that I've never changed, it is PERFECT as it. 

 One tip that I might be able to provide is that over time I've figured out that it tastes best when served with pita chips or warm baguette slices.
This was awesome! I made this for a party I had in December. The only addition I made was to add sour cream and I swear I could have eaten this by myself! Best dip ever!!

I made it exactly as written. I worried that the jalapeños might make it TOO spicy, but they give it just the kick that had been lacking in standard artichoke dip. This dip was gobbled up by both kids and adults! It's a winner!
I made this for a New Years Eve party and it was a hit!! I did use two tablespoons of mayo and three Tblsp. of sour cream. Other than that followed the recipe to a tee! It was delish!!!
So easy to throw together and delicious!!!!

This recipe was great! I did add some garlic but otherwise I was true to the recipe and it went over very well! Next time I make it I will consider adding some liquid as it did harden quite a bit as it cooled.

I could tell just by reading the ingredients that I was going to love this recipe - what I did not expect was how much it was loved by party guests when I made it as an appetizer. This dip was the highlight of the night, and there was absolutely none left over. I served it in sough dough bread bowls and there wasn't even a piece of crust left.

I also used Romano instead of Parmesan, but that's simply a personal preference.
I've made this twice and it's yummy! I use Greek yoghurt in place of mayonnaise, and use whatever shredded cheese I have on hand. I put it in a 9X13
I have made this several times exactly as the recipe states. It is wonderful!

This was sooooo good! I made it for a party and it was devoured. I didn't think I'd be able to handle the spice of the jalapenos (I used canned this time and I normally make sure to get all the seeds and membrane out - I'm a wuss) but it was delicious! The cream cheese cut down on the spice nicely. I added a few cloves of minced garlic, half a cup of sour cream and a little bit of onion powder. Also a little extra spinach, and mozza cheese (just because my parmesan was expired). This is my new favourite dip! It has a nice kick without being too spicy. Will definitely make again. Thanks for the recipe!!
Excellent dip. Substituted some of the mayo for sour cream and used fresh peppers and added fresh garlic. Thumbs up from my family!

Excellent. It would be difficult to come across another spinach/artichoke/jalapeno recipe that was better than this. A couple of changes I made, just because I didn't feel like grating fresh cheese, I just bought a bag of generic walmart shredded parmesan cheese. Still melted in all nicely, and made it easier. Also, I like a little more "hot" jalapeno dices, so I put a little more in mine. I also used half mayo half sour cream, and sprinkled some garlic powder in it. The overall change, I'm sure, was negligible. Easy and very very tasty. It made more than I expected, and me and the 3 kids ate every last bite. Thanks.
Holy shmoly!! This ones a hit at parties.. I usually use the Italian cheese from TJ's that has 4 different types & fresh jalapeño & a can or two of green chilis!

I make this all the time especially for the upcoming holidays!

However I tweaked the recipe with removing the mayo can add Greek yogurt in its place for added protein. Use extra jalapenos with a touch of the juice & artichokes in ours. Can sub canned spinach which is quicker to remove liquids. We are garlic fanatics so we add either dried or fresh depending on what is at hand. Also use shredded Italian blend cheese if no yogurt to add flavor .
The universe needed this spinach dip. It's freakin fantastic! No need to change the original recipe in my humble opinion.
Absolutely fantastic made with canned artichoke hearts instead of marinated. I could eat this every day!
I like the kick with this one. Instead of jalapenos from the can/jar I used a fresh one and next time will be adding two! I made for a few guests and everyone enjoyed it.
Loved the nice spicy kick to this dip.
Awesome dip. Couldn't get enough. Don't be afraid to kick up the artichokes and chilies and peppers.

The first time I made this, I made it as-is, and it was excellent! The second time, though, based on other reviewer's suggestions and my own personal preferences I did switch it up a bit. I used half mayo, and half sour cream. I used fresh diced jalapeños because I love them, and threw in some real lump crab. Because of the lack of vinegar from the pickled jalapeños, I added some garlic salt and Old Bay seasoning to taste for a little extra kick. Let me just say that with my changes this dip was PHENOMENAL!!! Easily a new favorite. :)
Made this exactly as written and it is delicious!!!!!!! I will be making this often, no changes needed.

item.name: Veronica's Hot Spinach, Artichoke and Chile Dip
